description:
Bobby Henrey is the child Phillipe and Ralph Richardson as Baines in the Fallen Idol from 1948. Deceptively simple, it's a memorable study of growing childhood awareness and adult complicity which won a Golden Globe, a BAFTA and three Oscar nominations. Newly restored, the film's to be re-released on DVD and Blu-ray, which gave me the excuse to talk to Robert Henrey who now lives in the United States. I asked him about the first time he knew about his audition for the Fallen Idol.

"I spent a lot of my childhood in Normandy with my grandmother, my French grandmother who would take care of me. And so I think the first thing I became aware of was my mother showing up and saying, you know, we're going to take a flight and I'd never been on a plane before. So that was a kind of an exciting idea. We're gonna take a little plane and we're gonna go over to London for the day. And there are some people who want to talk to you, and it has to do with a film. I don't think any of that meant very much to me. I mean, I think the exciting part of it was that I was going to have the opportunity to get on a plane for the first time. We arrived at the other end, picked up in a car and we go to this rather grand office. Carol Reed was there, I mean, they were obviously other people, they were a whole team, and they asked me questions and took pictures and gave us lunch. I remember the lunch, that was a very important part of the whole thing. And you know, I was eight years old and really had no clear idea as to what was happening."
